website_summaries.verdict: Featuring high-end seafood meal, an immune system-boosting recipe, and a quickly-sinking pellet form that will minimize the air your goldfish intakes during dinnertime, Omega One’s pellets are excellent for goldfish of all sizes.
pros: Salmon and whole herring are the first 2 ingredients
Rich in healthy omega-3 and 6 fatty acids
Pellet size appeals to all size fish
cons: If your goldfish is picky, and this pellet is ignored completely, it may dissolve and make your aquarium cloudy over time

customer_reviews.title: Killed all my pond and aquarium fish
customer_reviews.text: So I have been feeding my fish this food for over a year. However, this last batch killed my fish in my 55gallon (they developed white strings on their bodies, one had his eye go full white). I was feeding my pond fish the same thing and they also died, all within a week of the tank fish. There was no other common factor (no common nets, filters, no new fish added or other things that might have been contaminated or diseased) besides the food. All fish were healthy and vibrant before this. They did well on this food up until the bad batch...
customer_reviews.author: OG_Engineer

customer_reviews.title: 4mm did not sink: Stop read my redux!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2mm pellets by mistake but used them for test. Each and every pellet sank. My fish loved them, both small and large. Made the purchase of a 4mm pellet...They Do Not Sink. Almost all floated which leads me back to bloat and bladder issues. Small pellets nice strong fish odor, much less on the 4mm. Is there a difference in quality??? Okay day three. I took some time to work with the 4mm pellet. Simply tossing them in gently greatly improved its sinksbility. I assume less air trapped on pellet allowing it to submerge. I give it 4 star.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: killed fish
customer_reviews.text: I have (had) four goldfish in a 55 gal. tank. Several days after feeding this product one fish lay at the bottom of the tank sick. The fish died a few days later. A second fish, a few days after feeding this product blew up like a balloon. This fish died several days later, I stopped feeding this product before killing the other 2 fish. One of the remaining 2 is acting sick. Bad product!
customer_reviews.author: kit10z

customer_reviews.title: My fancy goldfish LOVE them however two of my dojo loaches have choked ...
customer_reviews.text: My fancy goldfish LOVE them however two of my dojo loaches have choked to death after sucking these up that the goldfish miss. If you have dojo loaches with your goldfish, beware of that. I now soak them for 30 minutes before I feed (they take a long time to soften up) to minimize one of my loaches sucking these pellets into their gullets and choking to death on the hard pellet. I've also had one goldfish choke on these too but was able to work it out after 20 minutes. They stay hard for a long time. My pond goldfish and koi have no issues and love these the most to more expensive pond foods.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Harrington

customer_reviews.title: Order Medium You will get SMALL ones labeled as Medium
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered these 2 times now. Fish love them. I never paid attention to the actual size measurements of the pellets until I ordered the LARGE ones for the bigger fish. The MEDIUM pellets are definitely NOT 4mm but more like 2mm. SEE PHOTO. If those smaller ones shown in photo are actual MEDIUM ones as they were labeled then the actual SMALL pellets must be basically only dust particles..
customer_reviews.author: CRI

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Food!
customer_reviews.text: They're a little bigger than I expected, so I definitely have to soak them before feeding, but my goldfish loves them! They're only a little smaller than a whole pea, so keep that in mind if your fish is still on the smaller side. Fantastic overall, though!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Medium vs Large
customer_reviews.text: The last time I purchased Omega One, I ordered the large pellets which I was cutting in half everytime I fed my rather large goldfish. So I thought I would try the medium size. I was a little surprised to find them a lot smaller than what I had expected. They still are good, just surprised is all.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: My Goldie Loves These!
customer_reviews.text: Ever since I started feeding my 6" goldfish these 4mm pellets, she wiggles and begs like crazy every time she sees me. It's as if she never had real food before! At first, after a lifetime of eating crumb-size pellets, she seemed not to know how to eat such big "burgers," but after a very short learning curve, she's now an expert and gobbles them up.
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: Pellets too large to swallow, makes water murky
customer_reviews.text: Based on Amazon review I tried this product for my adult goldfish. They have healthy appetite when they were fed with TetraFin flakes but all five of them had hard time swallowing the pellets. Too large for their mouths. After trying to swallow for a while they gave up. No more happy fish. I also noticed these pellets make tank water immediately murky. Not good. I’m going back to TetraFish.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Tanaka

customer_reviews.title: New Goldfish Food
customer_reviews.text: This food seems great for my larger goldfish. Noticed their color is getting better now that I have fed it to them for about a month. Sinks quickly. They sink much faster than the other "sinking" pellets you get from other brands. They have been keeping the water clean too. The medium pellet size is good for both my small (about 5 inch) and large (about 12 inches) goldfish. Love that it comes in bulk-sized containers.
customer_reviews.author: N. Hoch

customer_reviews.title: Sinking fish food
customer_reviews.text: Good food. May have to use a pvc pipe to let food sink down to its intended audience. My koi were eating the food before it sank for bottom feeders. Take a 1.2 or 3/4 pipe of sufficient length and stick in the water close to bottom fish, pour food in the pipe and it is protected to the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: RegularJoe

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after researching foods for my fancy goldfish. My fish started having swim bladder issues using this food. At the advice or a fellow fish keeper I switched to repashy goldfish food. All my fish are swimming great and look much healthier since going to the gel food.
customer_reviews.author: Irenekbeard

customer_reviews.title: Fish love it and now they are floating around funny inside the tank
customer_reviews.text: My fancy goldfish love these! And now my goldfish don’t float around strangely about because they are not eating only pellets that float up to the top causing them to take in lots of oxygen. This fixed this issue for any of these people who have goldfish.. and they’re swimming strangely, get some of these stinking pallets. It will fix that problem. Thx!
customer_reviews.author: Jayson K

customer_reviews.title: Bad batch!
customer_reviews.text: This batch must have been contaminated by fungus and bacteria, as only two days after I fed my fish with this, a severe fungal and bacterial infection was spreading in my fish tank! So sad, all my fish died few days ago! Be careful if you are using this!
customer_reviews.author: EmilyCTexas

customer_reviews.title: Goldfish are happy!
customer_reviews.text: I have big goldfish and the other pellets I bought were too small (API Goldfish sinking pellets). API is full of great ingredients but I wanted them to munch on something a little bigger. So I bought them the Omega One and they are so happy and satisfied!!! Omega One also has great ingredients so that's more of a plus. It makes me happy. I only put four stars because not all of them sink (2 out of 6), but I really don't care about that. I will be buying this one again. :)
customer_reviews.author: Miss Gold

customer_reviews.title: Great product! And healthy for your fish!
customer_reviews.text: My goldfish loves these pellets! It’s definitely a great deal, you can’t beat the price! And it’s nice to know I’m feeding him something that’s healthy. No meals of any kind, a lot of people don’t know how unhealthy that is for their fish. I won’t ever feed anything other than omega one!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Moore

customer_reviews.title: Sinking food that doesn't sink
customer_reviews.text: Though labeled as "sinking," this food doesn't sink, not even after floating 20+ pellets for 15 minutes. Also, these "medium pellets" are small, not medium as labeled. If they ever were to finally sink, they'd disappear between the 3/4" gravel in my pond.
customer_reviews.author: D. Moore

customer_reviews.title: my pond goldfish love this
customer_reviews.text: there are some goldfish in my pond ( approx. 800 gallons) that are over 10 years old. When I approach the "feeding" area, they come close to the surface to see what I am offering. When I throw the portion into the water, it sinks and they all go after it...
customer_reviews.author: Judith Osborn

customer_reviews.title: Great food for XLG Fancies
customer_reviews.text: Great for my XLG Fancies. I was afraid they would be different in size and quality because it’s in bulk but they’re exactly the same. Pellets are great size for large fish and sink at the right speed for enticing the fish. And they love the taste. Only problem is my Pleco has become possessive of the food. I’ll have to consult a Pleco shrink on that one.
customer_reviews.author: Carene neibaur

customer_reviews.title: One of the best foods for goldfish and koi
customer_reviews.text: Among other things, I feed these to both my goldfish and koi. Makes them grow fast and their colors are vibrant. Soak them first for at least 5 minutes because they're extremely hard. Anything under a 3 inch goldfish may have problems with the mediums because of the size, but koi of the same size or under have no problem with them because they have a bigger mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Brittingham

customer_reviews.title: Omega One Fish Food
customer_reviews.text: Good non-floating food for my goldfish. Most goldfish will not eat floating food. My fish are growing quickly and after just one winter are having babies, so the food must be working and making them happy.
customer_reviews.author: Greg S.

customer_reviews.title: Chow Time
customer_reviews.text: My Koi get all the floating food so as a treat I throw in a handful of these pellets for the goldfish to eat as it settles to the bottom of my pond.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Al

customer_reviews.title: Not good..
customer_reviews.text: I don’t recommend this.. First of all, this is really hard. so my goldies have difficulties to eat, so I soaked in water... but this resulted water cloud... I’m not gonna buy this again..
customer_reviews.author: Jeno Lee

customer_reviews.title: My fish are growing like weeds!
customer_reviews.text: I have found the Omega One pellets a good product. I don't really know about the flavor....as I personally haven't tried them, but the fish gobble them down! They are growing very quickly. I have an outside pond and so only feed them once a day as the fish have plenty of algae, plant matter, mosquito larva, etc., to feast upon.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer BTL

customer_reviews.title: Good fishfood. Been using it for about a year ...
customer_reviews.text: Good fishfood. Been using it for about a year after switching from another brand. Don't know if it affects the color or not, my gold fish akways looks good. One of my moors did turn golden though while the other moore is 100% solid black. I would also suggest soaking the pellets in water if you have small size fish or if you are transitioning fish from size small pellets.
customer_reviews.author: david owens

customer_reviews.title: Product is fresh; was delivered when promised
customer_reviews.text: These are the sinking fish pellets I was expecting and I'm happy that they must be very fresh as they're marked not to expire until March 2023. They arrived on my front porch when promised. My pond fish gobble them up off of their specially-made food ledge.
customer_reviews.author: Not a Digital Diva

customer_reviews.title: Make your fish wag
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this after reading another reviewer state his fish wag their tails looking for this treat. OK, I won't go that far. They're fish, not dogs... but yes, they do come looking for these and I almost notice that they swim to the side I put the pellets rather than the flakes if I feed them both at once. Great brand and the pellets are probably a good treat for them... I have rather large comet fish BTW.
customer_reviews.author: Merchandise Maven

customer_reviews.title: Better sized for larger goldfish, the pellets have a good sink rate
customer_reviews.text: Fourth year feeding our goldfish these pellets, and the fish keep growing. The pellets take about ten seconds to sink to the bottom of a 30 gallon tank. For my fish this enough to catch many on the way down, but still miss a few for a treasure hunt between feedings. When our goldfish were smaller (under three inches) we'd have to break the pellets up a bit, but once the fish grew a bit more the whole pellets work well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great food
customer_reviews.text: My gold fish love them, they mostly sink nicely on their own, they dont cloud the water and disintegrate fast. Nice quality and my fish are healthy
customer_reviews.author: Kelara101

customer_reviews.title: Awful product...fish won't eat
customer_reviews.text: This fish food, for whatever reason, is terrible. My fish won't eat it and if/when it sits at bottom of tank, within a short period of time, it develops this white, wispy film. It's awful. Won't buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Loretta Bell

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I've kept goldfish for a long time and Omega makes a good product. Can't say what it tastes like but the fish like it and many have lived on it in excess of fourteen years.
customer_reviews.author: R.E. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Different pellet size & color!
customer_reviews.text: I happened to have a little left over from a bottle of this pellets that I got from a local pet store. I think it's kind of weird that the one in this small bucket and the one I bought from a local pet store in a container has different color and size! They're both suppose to be the medium size but i realized that one pellet is smaller than the other; and the coloration of the pellet is in a different shade of blackish brown too! Not too sure but I think one or the other may be fake. Have anyone ever compare theirs?
customer_reviews.author: NraugCUAM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent fish food!
customer_reviews.text: These work great for my fish & tank. The fish love them & the pellets don't leave a mess like flake food. Will order again!
customer_reviews.author: Mary V

customer_reviews.title: Good deal!
customer_reviews.text: Good product, thought this would last me forever yet ill be buying this one again in about a month. Though it did last about 4-5 months.
customer_reviews.author: Jeron

customer_reviews.title: My goldfish love this stuff?
customer_reviews.text: My goldfish inhale this stuff. They love it. Sinking pellets tend to cause fewer issues with swim bladders also, so it's a good thing,
customer_reviews.author: Donald Shinn

customer_reviews.title: My koi and goldfish love it!
customer_reviews.text: The koi and goldfish love this food. They only eat sinking food and of all the sinking food they like this the most.
customer_reviews.author: Enid D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good deal and our fish love it!
customer_reviews.text: These pellets were much cheaper than in the pet store and our goldfish love them!
customer_reviews.author: mommykins

customer_reviews.title: Great Sinking Goldfish Pellets!
customer_reviews.text: I need to feed three different sizes of sinking goldfish food. The fancies do not see well and it is easier to feed from the bottom. The medium is perfect for the fish who have grown out of needing the small food. I can't always find the sizes needed in town so ordering it is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Mitsy

customer_reviews.title: Goldfish approved
customer_reviews.text: My goldfish are extremely enthusiastic about this food. Any time I walk through the room, they try to get my attention so that I'll give them more.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Killed my fish
customer_reviews.text: Caused swim bladder problems with my black moor and telescope goldfish. Sadly, my black moor has died after a week with the white string-like material all over his body. The telescope goldfish still can't swim right side up even after a few days of fasting.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Reszetylo

customer_reviews.title: My Goldie Gives It Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This has become my standard pellet for my goldfish. He loves it and stays nice and healthy from it. It does sink, but slowly enough that he's able to gobble it up quickly (as goldfish do). He's about seven inches long and I wouldn't recommend this size for smaller goldfish until they grow to his size. Once he's bigger, I might even stick with this size, though I'll see if he goes for the bigger stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Constantinos Maltezos

customer_reviews.title: Not happy !
customer_reviews.text: Well I'm not very happy this time when I ordered this fish food. It's says medium on the top of the container. But on the side of the container it's small pellets. And I can't send it back cause I already opened it because I was all out of food for my fish. I hope you can really help me out with this. Or I'm just going to go else were for my fish food. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Kayla sabine

customer_reviews.title: Fine but to big for my fish
customer_reviews.text: Got the wrong size pellets so my 2in gold fish can't eat them.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Humphrey

customer_reviews.title: Good for goldfish health
customer_reviews.text: Picky the goldfish loves this food. It sinks slowly so he can hunt it and the pick around at the bottom to find it after. I don't have to worry about him swallowing too much air because they readily sink
customer_reviews.author: lilbrownpony

customer_reviews.title: NEED QUALITY CONTROL TO REDUCE BAD ODOR
customer_reviews.text: Pallets odor is really bad. When you open the cap, it start smell bad. The food make water quality poor within 4 days( 2 times/ day with 5 goldfish in 75 gallons tank). Quality control please.
customer_reviews.author: Ideal

customer_reviews.title: Food for my fish
customer_reviews.text: My 2 1/2" goldfish will not eat them. I thought was buying best food available for my my fish.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: COMETS LOVE THEM!
customer_reviews.text: these are my 2 comet goldfish in a holder so i could show them off a bit, but they LOVE this food! it made them nice and fat and cute, and they go crazy for this stuff :)
customer_reviews.author: Todd Titschinger

customer_reviews.title: Koi fish love it
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my koi fish, very happy with this product!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Guandalini

customer_reviews.title: Good food but expensive
customer_reviews.text: Item was eh at we needed. The container was a bit dirty when we received it but other than that it was great. The pellets floated briefly and then sank exactly the way we wanted. The only complaint we could say is it is pricey compared to other brands of koi food.
customer_reviews.author: KristieTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: fish like it
customer_reviews.text: My fish like it. It does sink to the bottom pretty fast I wish it floated
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Sinks and fish like it
customer_reviews.text: The pellets seem more like "small" than "medium", but they sink and my fish like them
customer_reviews.author: Dewey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Great deal. Just save you empty jar to refill with this.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Fish love it.
customer_reviews.text: 2nd purchase of these. My largish (about 6 in) goldfish love them. Be careful not to overfeed, they will cause the water to become cloudy if too much is uneaten.
customer_reviews.author: karen

customer_reviews.title: Quick Delivery, Fish love it.
customer_reviews.text: Works great my fish love it, I did find it odd that during this review I was asked to rate the flavor.... 1 star....Not good to eat lol.. But seriously its a great product, I would recommend it if someone asked me what to buy thier fish
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again
customer_reviews.text: My goldfish LOVE this food and are thriving on it, they seem to prefer it over other brands, they are 2 years old and counting....
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again
customer_reviews.text: Goldfish seems to like this. Not enough companies offering large sinking food
customer_reviews.author: Mike V.

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: Great quality gold fish food. Is less dirty than flakes. Quick delivery and just what my black moor needed. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Shira

customer_reviews.title: Easier to eat
customer_reviews.text: Hard like the large ones but smaller fish can eat before larger fish finish the big ones.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Gobble gobble
customer_reviews.text: My fancy goldfish make these pellets disappear. I will name them all houdinis. 😂
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Some of my pond goldfish are 11 years old. ...
customer_reviews.text: Some of my pond goldfish are 11 years old. They survive under various weather conditions,and in the large aquarium during our harsh winters. I am not one to do research on countless seasonal foods for them,so this is their basic diet. They survive quite well and have no health issues.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann Predebon

customer_reviews.title: I think my fish liked it but right at the feeding time it was ...
customer_reviews.text: The tank that I have for my “long lived” gold fish has decorative rocks at the button of the tank. Therefore, the pellets sink. I think my fish liked it but right at the feeding time it was able to eat couple. Later all fell under the rocks. I am feeding him/her flakes type. I am not going to change it’s environment since I had this fish for 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: Tata’s painting

customer_reviews.title: My fish love it
customer_reviews.text: My koi and goldfish love this brand. They sink quickly and they go nuts over it.
customer_reviews.author: Britney D

customer_reviews.title: Happy, healthy goldfish!
customer_reviews.text: I think this brand is one of the best fish foods out there, especially for the price. The pellets sink, so you don't have to worry about your goldfish gulping air at the surface. My fish look fantastic and are growing beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Fish like it
customer_reviews.text: Gold fish like it. Easy to toss far out into the pond.
customer_reviews.author: David Kandel

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps my new favorite food. Some major brands (including that good one from Japan) don't offer medium or large pellets. These med pellets are perfect for my fish which vary from 2 inches to 8+. Sinking pellets so they are ideal for curved back fish, like ranchu. Fish gobble it up.
customer_reviews.author: TABco

customer_reviews.title: Price Gouged
customer_reviews.text: Even ggl advertises these for 4.13 on here, now that the 8oz is out of stock, these 4oz cost just as much as 8oz!
customer_reviews.author: The Sicilian

customer_reviews.title: They don't sink instantly but the fish go crazy for ...
customer_reviews.text: They don't sink instantly but the fish go crazy for them. They're growing and vibrant. I give them some peas to help their digestion and keep their swim bladders healthy.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred

customer_reviews.title: My goldfish love this. I prefer the sinking pellets and they ...
customer_reviews.text: My goldfish love this. I prefer the sinking pellets and they work great. I do soak them for about 5 minutes to soften them a bit. Packaged well and arrived on time.
customer_reviews.author: PJ Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Fish love the pellets!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because my double fan tail goldfish has issues with its swim bladder. I needed a sinking pellet to help with this. So far it seems to be helping.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Excellent goldfish food for larger goldfish.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great food. Possibly the best available. I made the mistake of not checking the size of the pellet and it is a little bigger than I wanted but that is my fault. Just be sure to check the size before ordering.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Good product for decent price. Fast delivery. Feeding my fish with this for about a year now; they are healthy and love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great food with quality ingredients
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think my tiny baby goldfish would be able to eat these, but boy was I wrong! I put them in there for my big boy but the little ones go after them quite fervently as well. Great food with quality ingredients
customer_reviews.author: Lilly

customer_reviews.title: High quality ingredients, priced accordingly
customer_reviews.text: Fish seem to like it; come and nibble enthusiastically :)
customer_reviews.author: Lady Justice

customer_reviews.title: Good food for gold fish
customer_reviews.text: My goldfish like these a lot. They are easy to dispense,and sink to the bottom rapidly where the fish happily search for them. My fish are about six inches long, and are very healthy. I recommend this food .
customer_reviews.author: EuclidAve

customer_reviews.title: OK stuff.
customer_reviews.text: My fish liked this. Not so the large pellets (see other review). Now I think I know why this was $10 more than the large pellets in the 2.5 pound quantity.
customer_reviews.author: George R Mells

customer_reviews.title: My fish say IT’S DELICIOUS.
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for years for my fancies. They gobble it up.
customer_reviews.author: TABco

customer_reviews.title: Flavor
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how my Goldfish and coy like these. They don't flock to the pellets at feeding time, but they are usually gone by the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Not as shown!
customer_reviews.text: Pellets sink to rot on the bottom! The photo didn’t describe them as sinking, but the actual packaging on arrival did.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Grasmoen

customer_reviews.title: Good Pellets
customer_reviews.text: I love these sinking pellets. It's a great way to help make sure your goldfish do not get swimming bladders disease.
customer_reviews.author: Cathleen P.

customer_reviews.title: It is great food and my goldfish absolutely love it and they ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because of a review I read from someone that was knowledgeable about feeding fish. It is great food and my goldfish absolutely love it and they look healthy.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Barbaccia

customer_reviews.title: All good. Thanks
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and fish eat it. All good. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: J Stahl

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I’m surprised at how much my fish have grown (53 goldfish and shubunkins in a 625 gallon pond) in 6 months. My fish are happy, healthy and their colors are vivid with this food. They love this food!
customer_reviews.author: KRR

customer_reviews.title: the one
customer_reviews.text: my staple food : these pellets and the flakes also,-love the real food ingredients- all my fish eat omega one primarily. but i get them different types/brands for an occasional change of pace. Doesn't muddy up my tank- (Fluval Ackkkkk)
customer_reviews.author: Paula M

customer_reviews.title: Plan to buy again
customer_reviews.text: Great product. My fish loves it and it is cheaper than my local fish store.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: Our Goldfish Love It
customer_reviews.text: We bought 1" goldfish a few years ago. Now they're 6" plus. This is one of the main things we feed them. Not sure if it's the very best kind of food for them but they love it and keep growing!
customer_reviews.author: Jane R

customer_reviews.title: Sinking pellets they love it.
customer_reviews.text: Gold fish are getting too big. Sinking pellets they love it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Marks

customer_reviews.title: Not for my fish
customer_reviews.text: My fish just payed around after eating it two days in a row. I switched back to lens veggie sticks and they were fine.
customer_reviews.author: DS Breeding

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Our koi and goldfish love these I just wish they came in a bigger container.
customer_reviews.author: S- Tx

customer_reviews.title: Seems like this is great food
customer_reviews.text: I have my grandaughter"s goldfish she won at a carnival. She is 11 years old now and 10 inches long. Seems like this is great food.
customer_reviews.author: Well Read

customer_reviews.title: It does seem to dirty the water a little
customer_reviews.text: I mix a little bit of this with the Hikari Cichlid Staple food and feed it to my large goldfish. It does seem to dirty the water a little, but not too bad. They seem to like it.
customer_reviews.author: J Burns

customer_reviews.title: Great for supplementing my Koi’s diet
customer_reviews.text: I supplement my Koi’s diet with some of this. They go crazy for it.
customer_reviews.author: Conrad R

customer_reviews.title: BEST USED BY 2010
customer_reviews.text: I just noticed that the label on the fish food is: BEST USED BY 2010! Food does not have a rich brown color, it does look very light in color. I have been feeding my beautiful expensive fish OLD FOOD! I would not use this seller again!
customer_reviews.author: Lolo Maral

customer_reviews.title: Big fish
customer_reviews.text: My fish are big so this keeps them fed for a while
customer_reviews.author: Jan Craddock

customer_reviews.title: ... in a fish pond with waterfalls and it works best because it sinks and doesn't float into the filter
customer_reviews.text: I use these in a fish pond with waterfalls and it works best because it sinks and doesn't float into the filter. Once it's wet and settles into the water.
customer_reviews.author: Annie B.

customer_reviews.title: KILLER
customer_reviews.text: Killed all of my pond fish after using it only twice in two days.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Brown

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My fish love it and I'm happy with the quality of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Well, I don't know...
customer_reviews.text: ...the fish at least seem to eat it. Even the turtle has taken a swipe at the floaty stuff, though she's eat just about anything in the tank. Except the fish that she gave amnesty to and refuses to eat. Thus, I bought the fish food....
customer_reviews.author: XcapeArtix

customer_reviews.title: My Fantails Love It
customer_reviews.text: 2 Spoiled Fantails love this. I do soak it for about 10-15 min before giving it to them. Just to soften it up for them, plus it will sink faster, to much air gulping can cause swim bladder issues.
customer_reviews.author: maria phillips

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Sinking pellets are great. Fish don’t gulp air and pellets all get eaten, keeping tanks cleaner. Great value
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great goldfish food.. Floats for a few minutes then sinks to the bottom
customer_reviews.author: Old Old Ben

product_meta.title: Omega One Goldfish Pellets, Sinking, 4mm Medium Pellets
feature_bullets: FOR SENSITIVE SYSTEMS: Omega One Goldfish Pellets are formulated specifically for the sensitive goldfish digestive system. They are 100% meal free and contain significantly less starch than other goldfish foods

COLOR-BOOSTING NUTRITION: Hand-harvested fresh ocean kelp provides critical nutrients and aids in digestion. Natural beta carotenes in salmon provide extreme color enhancement. Rich in Omega 3 & 6 for improved energy and immunity
KEEP A CLEANER TANK: Our Sinking Goldfish Pellets are naturally insoluble, which reduces water pollution, and they have significantly less starch, which reduces fish waste
INSTRUCTIONS: Feed 1-3 times daily, using only as much food as fish can consume in two minutes
GUARANTEED ANALYSIS: Min Crude Protein 35% / Min Crude Fat 10% / Max Crude Fiber 3% / Max Moisture 8.5% / Max Ash 8%
